title: how to view the replay file?
body: i downloaded replays but i dont know how to view the actual file in my replays folder. how do i view the rofl file on my laptop?

replies.body: Are you meaning the replays function built into the client or a third-party application used for viewing replays? We explain how the replays for the League client will work in [this post.](http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/client/client-features/road-pre-season-replays-horizon)

Hi riot, i have a question about the replay too. I downloaded a few replays from my match history, so where did they go?
Is there a file or something in my computer that I can view or something?
Should be in a league of legends file on your computer in a sub file that is either replays or highlights
what about the games that was downloaded in my client but it only shows the last 20 games in the client and the game i game i download was 23 games go

I found a workaround. Make sure you know which file is the replay you want to view. Then download a replay from one of the games in your current match history. Identify which file is the one that was just created. Copy the full filename of the recent replay you just downloaded. Then delete the file of the recent replay. And then rename the old replay you want to watch to the name of the new replay you just deleted. Then go to your client and try to play the replay that you just downloaded. This should get you the game you actually wanted instead of the one that you would normally be getting.
You're a hero. A legend, in fact. It's obvious but it did not occur to me.
i would like to have the answer for his question
I have downloaded one of my replays and saw it in my replay folder, but how do i view it? it gives me apps, but the apps doesn't work. What do i need?
After hou much time the games are not able to download/view ?

What about a "downloaded" game that disappeared from last 20 games match history? I am really sad that I can no longer access this because I didn't have to to review it at the time of that game, and now its gone from my match history and I really wanted to record that game or save it. I did download it I think, but since I cant see it in the match history, I can view the downloaded file? riot plz help!!

I found the replays in my hard drive following these directions: This computer -> Dokuments -> League of Legends -> Replays. But there is no way of viewing them but there your replays should be. I tried to open them with the client but no luck. It does show the logo "League of Legends" like if you're about to join a game or firing up a replay but nothing more.
Hope this helps and if anyone finds a way of watching these replays please answer.

after downloading the game what you might want to do is record it because that game will not be available forever as it can only be played through the client and as you play more games, the previous games starts to disappear, so will the replay. i use my xbox app available on my windows 10 to record the clip by pressing  win+g{{sticker:slayer-jinx-catface}}
I don't see the download or replay option in the match history page. Is this only exclusive to the beta client?
Yes, you can download/watch replays only in new client.

You have to do it from the client. Go to your match history, find the game you watch to watch, and press the little button to the right of the game listing to launch the replay. 

If you choose to record highlights, you can open those files directly in a browser.
can i send the file to a friend to review?

Right now, no. You can only launch the replays through your own match history. If a friend sends you their file, it still won't show up in your match history so you won't be able to play it.

If somebody has a specific moment they want to share, they can use the record feature and then send you that video file, and you'd be able to watch that.
